titlestmt.titleproper: DC Public Library Oral History Project
DC Public Library Oral History Project OHP003
titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the DC Public Library Oral History Project at DC Public Library
titlestmt.author: DC Public Library, Special Collections Department

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-05-05 09:46:34 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid revised to be more evergreen.

did.unittitle: DC Public Library Oral History Project

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Series 1: Transcripts
Materials in this series include transcripts for most interviews. There is no transcript for 03-54.
Series 2: Bound Editions
Materials in this series consist of bound transcripts of two individuals, Nora Drew Gregory and G. R. F. Key. Additional copies of this series have been added to the Washingtoniana Book Collection.
Series 3: Interviews
Materials in this series include master and patron access copies of the oral histories on audio cassette. There are two copies of each audio cassette except for the following: 03-01, 03-02, 03-03, 03-05, 03-16, 03-17, 03-18, 03-19, 03-29, 03-30, 03-31, 03-39, 03-40, and 03-56.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The DC Public Library was created by an act of Congress in 1896. The first branch of the DC Public Library was built in 1911 in Takoma Park. Soon after, additional facilities were added with a total of 26 branches across the District. In 1982, the DC Public Library established the Oral History Research Center (OHRC). The Center was funded in part by the D.C. Humanities Council. Since then, the Library has conducted its own oral histories as well as acquired tapes recordings and transcripts from individuals or groups who conducted their own oral histories to OHRC to enhance public access.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: DC Public Library conducted these oral histories between 1972 and 1992. Deposit into the Library's collection occurred at the time the interview was conducted. The interviews were organized and conducted by Marcia M. Greenlee and Roxanna Deane.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was arranged by date of interview and all files were foldered and placed in a filing cabinet. Tapes were duplicated by the Library with the original being placed into off site deep storage, and patrons given access to the use copy. Transcripts from two interviews in this collection, those of G.R.F. Key and Nora Drew Gregory, have been bound and cataloged with the Washingtoniana Book Collection. All known tapes and transcripts for this collection were digitized in 2014. There are no tapes for interview 03-59 and no transcript for interview 03-54. In 2017 the collection was reprocessed with standard archival procedures, and all materials being placed in new folders and boxed. Administrative materials were moved to the control file. Master tapes and use copies were placed in interview order and boxed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Between 1972 and 1992 the DC Public Library conducted 29 oral history interviews with individuals who had a long association with and knowledge of Washington, D.C. Topics include childhood experiences, segregation, religion, neighborhoods, education, communities, employment, demographics and social life.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction of oral histories without a release is not permitted. DC Public Library holds copyright for all items in the collection with a signed release.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include transcripts for most interviews. There is no transcript for 03-54.
